decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The hereby approved rear rooflights to the roof slope of the hereby development shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to the dwelling on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| External windows and doors, excluding roof lights, hereby permitted shall be timber framed, painted, and so maintained.

Reason - To preserve or enhance the appearance of the building and/or the character of the conservation area in accordance with London Plan Policy HC1, Local Plan Policy 7C, and the conservation area. | Due to the restricted floor to ceiling height, the roof space on the second storey of the building as shown on the approved plans must not be a habitable space, such as a bedroom, kitchen, or living room. Use of the space for utilities, appliances, and storage and other similar uses is permitted.
Reason: To preserve the quality and design of housing developments in accordance with London Plan Policy D5, the Housing Design Standards LPG, and the Local Plan Policy 3.5.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved documents: GD2553/04B, GD2553/02C
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
description: Single storey rear extension; dormer window to rear roof slope; replacement windows to front and rear elevations; replacement rear garden shed
